<small>Aramaic form: [[H5191]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָטַל‎</span> **verb** ==lift, bear== (rare synonym of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשָׂא‎</span> Biblical Aramaic [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְטַל‎</span> ***lift***; hence specifically, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***sustulit***</u></abbr> (aquam), further, ***be heavy***; also borrowed and denominative forms in Arabic and Late Hebrew, compare [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>65 f.</sup>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Lam.3.28|Lam 3:28]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִטּוֺל‎</span> [[Isa.40.15|Isa 40:15]] ***Participle active*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוֺטֵל‎</span> [[2Sam.24.12|2Sam 24:12]] — ***lift***, with accusative [[Isa.40.15|Isa 40:15]] (figurative subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>); ***lift over thee*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span>) i.e. offer [[2Sam.24.12|2Sam 24:12]], but read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוֺטֶה‎</span> (as \|\| [[1Chr.21.10|1Chr 21:10]]) [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] [[BDB#HPS|HPS]]; ***lift (and lay) upon*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span>) [[Lam.3.28|Lam 3:28]]. **Pi\`el** ***Imperfect*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַטְּלֵם‎</span> [[Isa.63.9|Isa 63:9]] ***and he bare them***, figurative of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> bearing his people (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְגַשֵּׁאֵם‎</span>).
